title: Parliament votes to water down EU's packaging waste law - EURACTIV
summary: The European Parliament adopted legislation to reduce packaging waste, but some key measures were weakened, including those on reuse and bans, after a tense debate and lobbying. The law aims to increase recycling and set targets on reuse and waste prevention to combat the 190 kilograms of packaging waste produced per European yearly. However, some measures were diluted, sparking concerns on how waste reduction targets will be achieved.
green_innovation: FALSE. The article discusses legislative changes related to packaging waste management and recycling targets, which do not meet the criteria of a green innovation as it focuses on regulatory measures rather than new environmental technologies or processes.

green_product: TRUE. The discussion on reducing packaging waste, promoting recycling, and setting targets for reuse aligns with the definition of a green product as it addresses the significant reduction of environmental impact throughout the product's life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not focus on methods or techniques in manufacturing that minimize environmental impacts, but rather on legislative regulations pertaining to packaging waste reduction and recycling targets.
